definitions.title: Use of Nouns
definitions.definition: Identify the use of the underlined noun in each sentence.
definitions.example: Example: This city is a mighty big place.
definitions.explanation: The noun 'city' is the subject of the sentence.

definitions.title: Indirect Object
definitions.definition: Recognize nouns used as indirect objects in sentences.
definitions.example: Example: Please hand me that book.
definitions.explanation: ‘Me’ is the indirect object receiving the direct object ‘book’.

definitions.title: Direct Object
definitions.definition: Determine when a noun acts as a direct object.
definitions.example: Example: Grandma made my sister a beautiful dress.
definitions.explanation: ‘Dress’ is the direct object, receiving the action of the verb ‘made’.

definitions.title: Appositive and Object of Preposition
definitions.definition: Identify appositives and nouns used as objects of prepositions.
definitions.example: Example: My mother, Benny, prides herself on her collection.
definitions.explanation: ‘Benny’ is an appositive, renaming ‘mother’; ‘collection’ is the object of preposition ‘on’.

definitions.title: Predicate and Object of Preposition
definitions.definition: Recognize nouns used in predicate and prepositional phrases.
definitions.example: Example: I excitedly handed my grades to my father.
definitions.explanation: ‘Father’ is the object of the preposition ‘to’.

definitions.title: Adverbs of Place
definitions.definition: Adverbs of place tell where the action happens.
definitions.explanation: ‘Outside’ shows the place where the action happens.

definitions.title: Adverbs of Frequency
definitions.definition: Adverbs of frequency tell how often something happens.
definitions.example: Example: Rex always waits for Philame.
definitions.explanation: ‘Always’ shows how often the action happens.

definitions.title: Adverbs of Manner
definitions.definition: Adverbs of manner describe how an action is performed.
definitions.example: Example: Marky ate the food hungrily.
definitions.explanation: ‘Hungrily’ describes how Marky ate the food.

definitions.title: Adverbs of Time
definitions.definition: Adverbs of time tell when an action happens.
definitions.example: Example: The game will start early.
definitions.explanation: ‘Early’ shows the time when the game will start.

definitions.title: Adverbs of Place (Again)
definitions.definition: Another example of adverbs of place.
definitions.example: Example: I’m sure I have seen this car somewhere.
definitions.explanation: ‘Somewhere’ shows the place where the action may have occurred.

definitions.title: Modals of Promise
definitions.definition: Use modals to show future actions or intentions.
definitions.example: Example: I will call you when dinner is ready.

definitions.title: Modals of Possibility
definitions.definition: Use modals to show what is possible or likely.
definitions.example: Example: The shops are closed. I must be very late.

definitions.title: Modals of Ability
definitions.definition: Use modals to express ability or potential.
definitions.example: Example: Spain can be very hot during summer.
definitions.explanation: ‘Can’ shows that something is possible or likely.

definitions.title: Modals of Obligation
definitions.definition: Use modals to express duty or necessity.
definitions.example: Example: Everybody should eat less fatty food to be fit.

definitions.title: Modals of Uncertainty
definitions.definition: Use modals to express doubt or possibility.
definitions.example: Example: It might be the postman.
